title: Inscribed Angle Theorem
theorem: An inscribed angle is half the measure of its intercepted arc
given: Circle with center O. Points A, B, C on circle. ∠ACB is inscribed, arc AB is intercepted

steps.content: Draw radii OA and OB to form central angle ∠AOB

steps.note: Incorrect: O, A, C are not necessarily collinear or form an isosceles triangle in the way stated

steps.content: Similarly, triangle OBC is isosceles, so ∠OBC = ∠OCB

steps.note: Conclusion is correct but proof is flawed
